name: Enterprise Privacy Using ZK
description: A short talk about where things stand in building privacy technology for blockchains after Tornado cash.  EY is still committed to building privacy technology but we've had to modify our approach.  I'll share what we're doing and how we're trying to make confidentiality work for enterprises while preserving the permissionless and open ecosystem approach on Ethereum.  The presentation will be non-technical.
gpt_description: In this video, Paul Bernand, the global blockchain leader at EY, discusses enterprise privacy in the CK field. He explains that most enterprise deals require a different kind of privacy than what most individual users need and that private blockchains don't work. Bernand introduces Nightfall, a layer to ZK-Optimistic Privacy Rollup that EY has been working on since 2017. He explains that Nightfall is a shield contract that requires an enterprise identity certificate to use and is confidential but not anonymous. Bernand also discusses the cost of transactions and the development process of Nightfall.
